alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 12:36PM EST until February 05 at 2:23AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Suwanee Creek near Suwanee affecting Gwinnett County. For the Suwanee Creek...including Suwanee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Suwanee Creek near Suwanee. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at U S Highway 23 or Buford Highway. Portions of the Suwanee Creek Park off of Suwanee Creek Trail begin to flood to Martin Farm Road. This will also include areas behind the Suwanee Elementary School and the George Pierce Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 8.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 8 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
